turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Why are you looking at me like that?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Like what?  I'm not --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're staring at me.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: No I'm not.  I'm not star--

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yes you are...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: They're going to want answers and they're going to keep asking until they get them.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: We can refuse to talk.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Won't make any difference.  The tapes document everything.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: When did it come across?

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: Minutes ago.  Harry's trying to decode it in his room now.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Where's it coming from?

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: No idea.  We have no surface support. It transmitted too fast to be coming from underwater.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Is it coming from our own computer?

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: Harry thinks it's some sort of discharge from our own system, but I've seen it discharge before -- and it didn't look anything like this.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How are you feeling, Norman?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You holding up alright?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Fine.  I'm fine.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Don't be defensive.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I'm not being defensive.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You sound defensive.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Go ahead.  Ladies first.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: No, why don't --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: C'mon.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Wait a second, I --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: C'mon, Norman.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Look, would you --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Nice work, Norman.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Whatever I can do to help.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Our answer.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: To what?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Time travel.  A black hole.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: This answers one of our questions.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Which one?  Let me get the list out.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: This spacecraft was designed to pick things up.  They see things they want -- these claws go out and bring it in.  They come across this.  This... <u>sphere</u>.  Find it interesting, curious.  They draw it inside to take back home.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: But on the way home, they miss their turn, go too far, into the past.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Our present.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I mentioned it in my report.  Didn't you read the report?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Everything ever written about extra- terrestial life imagines that life is essentially human.  If it doesn't look human, it's a reptile or a big insect or something, having human values, human understanding.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: And we're just talking about three- dimensional creatures.  What if it's five or six or seven-dimensional?  So dimensional that we couldn't even see it to kill it.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Good point.  I don't know what you're talking about, but good point.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Don't be so optomistic, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm completely serious.  There is something very important missing from that spacecraft.  You know what that is?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Not a clue.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: A sign that the builders knew time travel through a black hole was possible.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I don't follow you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: On that flight recorder, they called the black hole an "Unknown Entry Event." They didn't know what a black hole was.  Fifty years from now, men are going to build that ship in a very tentative, experimental way, with no knowledge that time travel through a black hole is possible.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So, <u>we know</u>.  We know it went through a black hole.  We saw it.  Norman -- when we'd get to the surface, we'd tell someone about the black hole, wouldn't we?  It'd go in some report like some big discovery.  So in fifty years when they build that ship, they'd make precautions for a black hole.  <u>But they didn't</u>.  The called it an Unknown Entry Event.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Meaning we're never gonna get the chance to tell anyone.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Meaning we're never gonna get to the surface alive... to tell anyone.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I can't believe that, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Gimme another explanation.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I can't.  If I had a minute to think, maybe, but I know you're wrong.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Am I?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Look -- we're under a lot of pressure, we're tired, you're not thinking straight.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You mean, you think I'm cracking?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: No.  I didn't say that.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Then what, Norman?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's what's in that sphere, isn't it, Harry?  Whatever you think is in that thing -- you think it's going to kill you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Curious, isn't it?  What's inside? Before I die, I'd sure like to open it and see.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What is that?  That noise?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What noise?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's like...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Harry, can you tell me about the sphere?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What are you still doing here?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You remember opening the door?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You were all supposed to leave.  You weren't supposed to stay down here.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Tell me about the door.  Do you remember how you opened the door to the sphere?... Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You don't understand about the sphere.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Then explain it to me.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Norman?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What is it, Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What happens on page 87?  Have you ever read page 87?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Page 87 of what, Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I could never read that far.  I never wanted to.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: That far in what, Harry?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: These aren't half bad, Fletcher.  You might have a second career coming.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What are they?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Getting anywhere with those?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: There's some sort of pattern here. It'll take a minute.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Have you looked outside?  Jellyfish. Everywhere.  I hate jellyfish.  Harry, what happened in the cafeteria?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Don't do this.  Don't psychoanalyze me.  I hate squid.  Period.  Just like you hate jellyfish.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You said something to me, before -- about how we were all going to die.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Did I?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You don't remember that?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I don't remember much.  It's like my memory is on the tip of my tongue -- but I can't taste any of it.  Funny, my senses are much keener though. Purer.  Hearing, seeing, smelling. Like, I can smell your sheets, Norman.  You tried to wash it out earlier, But I can still smell the urine.  Don't worry, I'm not going to tell the others.  It's normal, really, isn't it?  In a crisis.  The stress. The panic.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: ... you there?  Norman?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Norman, where are you?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I can't breathe...  Am I... clear?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're clear.  You see the airlock?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Thank you.  My suit -- Beth said she fixed it --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What happened to her?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What do you mean?  She's not here?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: When I woke up, nobody was here.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: She was supposed to be watching the sensor for me.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Her suit's gone.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth left?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I thought she was with you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She's cracking, Norman.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You didn't say that about the food?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I was just in the cafeteria, there's plenty of food in there.  Take a look for yourself.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: But why would she -- ?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She's lying, Norman.  Just like she lied about fixing your suit.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Wisconsin's your answer.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Wisconsin?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Navy transmission.  They're sent from Wisconsin.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: How do we decode it?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Don't have to.  Watch.  It'll do it for you.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: We just figured, you know, the three of us -- we need to... work together through this.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: The three of us.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Is that why the two of you went through my dufflebag?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You know what it is, Harry.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's the squid!  Stop it!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Stop what?  What are you -- ?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Did I kill her?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I could hit her a little harder. More toward the cranium.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Help me lift her.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: We're never gonna make it.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Shut up and open the door.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How much time you figure to get to the surface?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Two and a half minutes.  Once we're in the sub.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How far away's the sub?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I can't reach her.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Hold on.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Push her, c'mon.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I'm trying.  Shit.  Here -- catch her.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Missed.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Are you trying, damn it?  Just --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Hold on.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hurry, Norman.  Four minutes.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I heard!  I heard!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Three fifty-six, three fifty-five, three --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Shut up and catch.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: C'mon, Norman!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I'm trying to keep balance with --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Gimme a second --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Just pull her -- down like inside -- Harry, work with me here!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Her legs are in the way.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You got her?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Get her out of the seat, I need room to sit.  Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm trying.  There.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You know how to work this thing?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: No idea.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well, press something!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Wait!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Less than a minute, we're never gonna make it.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Nine hundred feet to surface.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's not fast enough, Norman. There's a helluva lot of explosive down there.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How's that working out, by the way?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Good.  Thank you.  Now that I have it on.  Why are you laughing?  You don't even know what that means.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No.  I don't.  But I always said to myself, when I die, I want to die laughing.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: There is one possibility.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: We all kill ourselves?  Bad joke.  Sorry, Beth.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: The power allows us to manifest our fears, right?  What if we feared the power to go away?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You mean forget?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It would erase all our knowledge of it.  All of our power.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What'd you say to him?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: To who?  Arthur?  Nothing.  Nothing that Norman doesn't already know.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What does Norman already know?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Norman thinks we shouldn't be going down.  Thinks it's a mistake.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She told me what you said, Norman.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What is it, Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Just one of Norman's many secrets.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: It's just like swimming, Norman... You know how to swim, don't you?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're not afraid of the water, are you, Norman?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Easy Ted, we're not mining gold.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Gimme some room here, will you?  Back off.  Gimme some space.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Alot like.  You know, I noticed it before, but I didn't...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Shutup, Ted.  You didn't notice shit. Keep hammering.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: English?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You don't think it does?  I think it's rather obvious.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Is it some sort of joke?  Like one of those hoaxes?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: A spacecraft half a mile long -- with 500 tonnes of coral on top of it?  Someone went to a lot of trouble.  Try again.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: But it's impossible.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Is it?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Why would this ship carry instructions in English?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Think about it.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Unless, this alien spacecraft was -- you know -- somehow presenting itself to Americans in a way that would make us feel comfortable.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: All the facts you need are right in front of you.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Gimme a minute here... I think I've got it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: If it is an alien spacecraft --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Save your breath.  It's not an alien spacecraft.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: An American spacecraft?  Half a mile long?  And buried 400 years?  Yeah, good theory, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's been obvious from the start, hasn't it, Captain?  That's why all the secrecy, why no one was told about it?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: We take a weeny little wedge, bang on it a couple of times, and bust off a chunk of the metal.  Yet any spacecraft -- even at a low velocity, say 200 miles an hour -- crashes into the water -- it's gonna be like hitting concrete, it would crumple like paper.  But there isn't a dent to be seen anywhere.  Not even a scratch.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Meaning?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Meaning it didn't land in the water.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Please.  It must have flown here --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It didn't fly here.  It <u>arrived</u> here.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Arrived?  From where?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Not where.  When.  400 years ago.  From our future.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Looks like a design, some writing, maybe.  Maybe it was sent to meet the spacecraft with a message.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Look closely.  That isn't writing. Those are grooves.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Hey, go easy on the salt, will ya? We're not a bunch of icy streets here.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Salt's good for you, Ted.  Helps you from getting impotent.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Impotent?  I'm not impotent.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well, if it's a discharge --

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: It's not a discharge.  Right, Edmunds?  You said before, right?  So it's gotta be a message.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: If it is a message, it's probably a substitution code.  I'll work on it.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Yeah, I'll work on it, too.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: ... I asked myself, why would the sphere be using a code?  If you're trying to communicate, why use a code?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: See?  No code.  What'd I say?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Codes are for <u>hiding</u> information.  So it's making a mistake.  It's making a code without intending to.  I figured it's probably substituting numbers for letters...  Then I began to wonder what an alien intelligence would make of our keyboard.  And since we're getting spirals, I imagined the keyboard as a spiral.  So I translated it...

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What'd you say?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: "We are friends".

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Good idea, Ted.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Don't gimme that psychology bullshit, Norman.  Psychology isn't a science, it's superstition.  It's a bunch of soft, subjective theories without any hard data to back it up. With an intellect like this, emotions don't mean shit.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's like showing Leonardo da Vinci a laptop computer.  He'd run screaming "witchcraft".  And you couldn't explain it to him, either. Modems, microchips, particle physics.

turns.speaker: NAVY SEAMAN
turns.text: Norman Johnson.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Does this mean what I think it means?

turns.speaker: NAVY SEAMAN
turns.text: It's over, sir, The storm has cleared.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: The ships?

turns.speaker: NAVY SEAMAN
turns.text: They're topside.  We're ready to take you home, sir.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: How are the others?

turns.speaker: NAVY SEAMAN
turns.text: The others, sir?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Beth and Harry?

turns.speaker: NAVY SEAMAN
turns.text: They're in the sub, sir.  Waiting.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: That whole time -- I couldn't stop thinking of what Harry was saying earlier...

turns.speaker: NAVY SEAMAN
turns.text: What was that, sir?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: About the time paradox.  How we were all going to die -- that there was no way we would make it out of here alive --

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Any other bags, Dr. Johnson?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Just that.  Careful, it's heavy.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: No other equipment?  Scientific instruments?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: No, they didn't say --

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: This way, sir.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Captain Barnes wants to see you right away, sir.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Captain who?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Barnes.  He's very eager to meet you. Been calling us every half hour to see if you're arrived.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: By the way sir, I've read your report.  I think it's brilliant.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What report?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: You mean they haven't told you yet?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Told me what?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I'm in psychology.  Was.  Still am really, just been a while.  I treat aircrash survivors.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Oh, so you're that Dr. Johnson.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You've heard of me?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Well, everybody's been talking about that report you wrote.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What report?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What report?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: You mean you don't know?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Know what?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Must be another Johnson then.  Been flying so many scientists out here -- can't keep everyone straight.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Who's everyone?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Physicists, mathematicians, geologists, you name it.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Geologists?  At a plane crash?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Strange, isn't it?  In the middle of the ocean no less.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What the hell would a geologist be doing at a plane crash?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: He wasn't feeling well.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: He's a pussy.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You want me to try?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: You're a 53 year old shrink, what are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Strange, isn't it?  You know -- how it would have a button.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Earth doesn't have a patent on buttons, Ted.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Still, make a note I recognized that.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: He's manic, Norman.  You know that? This reliance on Harry is misplaced. You hear me?  Totally misplaced.  He's overlooking things.  Obvious things.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: It's not some fucking substitution code, it's a direct visual representation.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You mean a picture?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Take a look.  I rearranged the numbers.  Put 'em up to the light.  Go ahead.  Squint at it.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I don't see anything.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Squint harder.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Please, Ted.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Try this one.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: This is like nursery school.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Don't you see it?  It's a picture of the creature.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: The creature?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Inside the sphere.  Look, that's the vertical torso, three legs, two arms.  There's no head, so I'm guessing the creature's head is located within the torso itself, you know?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Well, how about we wait and see what Harry comes up with?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Sure, why not.  Give him the trophy. That pretentious son of a bitch.  You heard him, Norman.  All that "someone went to a lot of trouble, try again" bullshit.  And "impotent".  Where does he get off saying I'm impotent?  He's a fucking self-righteous, little prick.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Well, he's polite.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Unless it's an act.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: You want to put him on your couch, Norman.  Grill him about his childhood?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: When he uses a phrase like "I am Happy", I think we should think twice about what we ask him.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Frankly, Ted, I'd be much happier if Jerry was just a cold, emotionless intellect.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Why's that?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What was it?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Barnes didn't know.  Couldn't get a reading.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Has Harry spoken with Jerry?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Not that I know of.  Why?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: You think Jerry has something to do with what killed Edmunds?  With what's out there?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Jerry isn't hostile, Norman.  He said earlier -- we were his friends --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Of course he did.  He's been isloated for 400 years.  He wants someone to talk to.  Look, you put a human being in isolation for four days, they can become neurotic, sometimes psychotic.  We're talking about 400 years here.  An alien that shows emotional responses.  I think we need to address him, before he reacts further.

turns.speaker: WIFE
turns.text: What kind of a crash was it?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You seen my suitcase?

turns.speaker: WIFE
turns.text: There's nothing on the news about a crash.  Did he say what airline?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: He didn't say much at all.  Honey --

turns.speaker: WIFE
turns.text: In the closet.  I don't understand, Norman -- why would they call you?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Don't be so supportive, honey.

turns.speaker: WIFE
turns.text: Well, I can't imagine five years of unemployment --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Four.  Four years --

turns.speaker: WIFE
turns.text: Four years of unemployment would look too good on a resume.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Keep watching the news.  Are you watching the news?

turns.speaker: WIFE
turns.text: How are you getting to the airport? You need money for the bus?

turns.speaker: WIFE
turns.text: There's a U.S.  Navy car outside, Norman.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WIFE
turns.text: Was it a military crash?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: WIFE
turns.text: They never used to send a Navy car.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I'm Han Solo, Captain of this vessel.  Who's in charge then?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm Ben Kenobi.  Luke Starkiller here is leading our expedition.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well, we'll see...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: You might get your stuff together. We'll be coming up on Organa Major soon.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: The Empire must have gotten here first.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: The planet has been totally blown away!  It would have taken a thousand ships with a lot more fire power than I've ever seen... If the Empire had a new weapon that could do this... I would have heard something... I'd know about it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well, now you know... The enemy is on the move.  We haven't much time.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Well, I've brought you here.  What now?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: We have to find he rebels... What we're carrying belongs to them.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Their bases are very well hidden. All the power of the Empire can't find them... Do you know where they are?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No, not anymore.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I'm not taking you on an impossible search across the galaxy... I was only paid to get you here and now you're here.  I'll take my other five thousand and you're on your own... I'll leave you on the nearest system.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well, for one reason, we don't have your other five thousand.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Who's going to pay me then?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I think there are some things we should talk about.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I'm beginning not to like you.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: How much do you think she's talking about?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: A million at least... If this robot has information related to the destruction of Organa Major, you'll be able to name the reward...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Anything I want!  Now that's interesting.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Luke's got a point... ... Fear is their greatest defense... I doubt if the actual security there is much greater than on Aquilae or Sullust, and what there is is most likely directed toward large-scale assault.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: This isn't a game, you know.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Kid, you take the glory and the good intentions and I'll take the reward.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Fear is their greatest weapon.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I'm not afraid of anything...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You have your father's style.  You've done very well.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Not bad.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: We're into the second perimeter. They'll be coming out to blast us shortly.  I was wondering if you had some kind of a plan or are we going to try to blast our way in?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Check your data banks for all the information you have on Imperial procedures.  Both of you will have to learn...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: We're going to get in by studying Imperial procedures?  I don't like it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: All right then, we'll use your plan.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I'll get the information.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: ... and I want you to start cleaning the equipment out of the scan- shielded compartments.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: What do you want with our scan-proof lockers?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Darth Vader is on this system.  I can feel him.  I can feel the Kiber Crystal.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Is that good or bad?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It's not good... unless I could find the Crystal.  Then it could be very good.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Don't look at me.  I'm just a pilot. I got you here... You've got to do the rest.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: There is a greater risk in staying here, you know.  If you don't find the princess, then the whole trip was for nothing... wasn't it?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I'm not going out there.
